content: While testing in the IDE, I noticed that the stub `write` command does not produce any output unless a value is specified. It might be worth updating the generator to include a default argument.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: so have many reasons to approve this contribution.
one of that many is the really straighforwardness of it I did struggle to code the solution but thats my fault for not having enough experience but overall really good and funny.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The statement is nice and all but it talks about "squared distance", so why do you use sqrt in you solution ?

Little confusing to understand when "distance squared" is mentioned, Maybe specifying the need to round to nearest integer would clear that up.
Also in output it would be clean if the sequence changes to something like "Neighbour if the distance is less than or equal to 1
He can if the square of distance rounded to nearest integer is even
He can't otherwise"
Anyway , I tried it in Java and it is a fun clash, Keep adding more :)

Binary output issue
* According to the contribution guidelines, binary outputs should be avoided for clashes. That's exactly the issue with your clash, as it allows only two possible answers (either "True" or "False"). Please modify the output requirement to allow for more than two possible answers.

Formatting
* Please study the formatting syntax on this page: https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement , and format your statement properly.

Goal
* Please format "x" and "y" as [[variables]] (separately, excluding the comma between them).

Input
* Please rewrite the input description following the example provided in the link above. Since x and y are given in separate lines, describe them separately.

* Also note that the correct spelling is "integer" instead of "interger".

Constraints
* Please specify the lower and upper bounds for x and y.

Cases
* Each test and its validator should cover the same scenario with slightly different inputs. No two cases should be identical. Please update the cases accordingly.

Thanks.
Thank you for your feedback. I have made the changes, I hope it’s suitable now.
Neighbour isn't equal or less than 1, it is indeed less than 2, Test 3 for instance is 1.4142, less than 2, though more than 1

It's better but some fixes are still required.

Goal
* Please specify the type of distance that should be calculated. For example, you may refer to: https://www.maartengrootendorst.com/blog/distances/

* Please format "x" and "y" as [[variables]].

* The output requirement hasn't been updated.

Input
* Please follow the example in the link provided in my previous comment. x and y are on TWO separate lines, and the current description should reflect that.

Output
* The word "And" seems to imply that "Neighbour" should be output when applicable *in addition to* "He can"/"He can't". Please clarify the wording as that's not the intended meaning.

Cases
* x = 0 in most cases. Please modify the cases so that x is positive in some cases, negative in some cases, and 0 in at most one pair of cases.

* Please revise one visible test so that y is negative in that case.

Thanks.

Constraints
* "Use Euclidean distance" is not a constraint. It's what needs to be done by the player. Please move those words to the Goal section.

Cases
* Please add a new pair of cases where both x and y are less than -10.

Thanks.
Thank you. I've just swapped Test 5 and Validator 5 to balance the answer distribution.
